trans-unit.source: Step 4: Test the EDI Solution
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Test the EDI Solution

trans-unit.source: In this step, we test the EDI solution by sending a message to the endpoint where the EDI receive <token>bridge</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: In this step, we test the EDI solution by sending a message to the endpoint where the EDI receive <token>bridge</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: You can send messages to the endpoint both in HTTP or SOAP protocols.
trans-unit.target: You can send messages to the endpoint both in HTTP or SOAP protocols.

trans-unit.source: The instructions below demonstrate how to send the message via HTTP.
trans-unit.target: The instructions below demonstrate how to send the message via HTTP.

trans-unit.source: To test the EDI solution
trans-unit.target: To test the EDI solution

trans-unit.source: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Build the project and use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command line executable to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token> endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Build the project and use the resulting <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> command line executable to send messages to the deployed <token>bridge</token> endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters is given below:
trans-unit.target: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters is given below:

trans-unit.source: Where,
trans-unit.target: Where,

trans-unit.source: Parameter name
trans-unit.target: Parameter name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ACSNamespace
trans-unit.target: ACSNamespace

trans-unit.source: The ACS namespace
trans-unit.target: The ACS namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Issuer Key for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Key for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: RuntimeAddress
trans-unit.target: RuntimeAddress

trans-unit.source: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.
trans-unit.target: Runtime address or the endpoint URL where the <token>bridge</token> is deployed.

trans-unit.source: You can get the deployment endpoint from the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.
trans-unit.target: You can get the deployment endpoint from the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the endpoint where the agreement is deployed resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: Typically, the endpoint where the agreement is deployed resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: MessageFilePath
trans-unit.target: MessageFilePath

trans-unit.source: Path to the file that contains the request message to be sent to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Path to the file that contains the request message to be sent to the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: This request message must be compliant with the <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema.
trans-unit.target: This request message must be compliant with the <embeddedLabel>X12_00401_840.xsd</embeddedLabel> schema.

trans-unit.source: You can use the X12840.edi sample message available as part of the sample available at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can use the X12840.edi sample message available as part of the sample available at <externalLink><linkText>MSDN Code Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316856</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: ContentType
trans-unit.target: ContentType

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether it’s an XML message or an EDI message.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether it’s an XML message or an EDI message.

trans-unit.source: For XML message, set this to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For XML message, set this to <embeddedLabel>application/xml</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For EDI message, set this to <embeddedLabel>text/plain</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For EDI message, set this to <embeddedLabel>text/plain</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, to test the EDI scenario, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project, and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, to test the EDI scenario, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the <embeddedLabel>MessageSender</embeddedLabel> project, and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: This application sends the message to the deployed endpoint and prints the success/failure message.
trans-unit.target: This application sends the message to the deployed endpoint and prints the success/failure message.

trans-unit.source: Upon successful completion, the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table in Northwind’s database must have a new sales order entry created.
trans-unit.target: Upon successful completion, the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table in Northwind’s database must have a new sales order entry created.

trans-unit.source: Because you chose to receive acknowledgements, you get those acknowledgements on the endpoint you specified as part of the EDI send settings.
trans-unit.target: Because you chose to receive acknowledgements, you get those acknowledgements on the endpoint you specified as part of the EDI send settings.

trans-unit.source: For example, for successfully processed acknowledgements, you specified the endpoint as <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, for successfully processed acknowledgements, you specified the endpoint as <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool to receive those acknowledgements.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool to receive those acknowledgements.

trans-unit.source: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> tool from <externalLink><linkText>Azure BizTalk Services Samples</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=303933</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Build the project and use the resulting command line executable to receive messages at a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Build the project and use the resulting command line executable to receive messages at a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters is given below:
trans-unit.target: This tool accepts command line parameter, and the sequence and usage of those parameters is given below:

trans-unit.source: Where,
trans-unit.target: Where,

trans-unit.source: Parameter name
trans-unit.target: Parameter name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> Namespace
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> Namespace

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerName
trans-unit.target: IssuerName

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: IssuerKey
trans-unit.target: IssuerKey

trans-unit.source: Issuer Key for the above namespace
trans-unit.target: Issuer Key for the above namespace

trans-unit.source: RelativeAddress
trans-unit.target: RelativeAddress

trans-unit.source: Relative address for the entity to be hosted.
trans-unit.target: Relative address for the entity to be hosted.

trans-unit.source: You get this address from the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab for the agreement you created in <link xlink:href="3cde1c5c-8d09-4b17-97af-435af2a19b64" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 3: Create Agreements Between Partner Profiles</link>.
trans-unit.target: You get this address from the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page of the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab for the agreement you created in <link xlink:href="3cde1c5c-8d09-4b17-97af-435af2a19b64" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 3: Create Agreements Between Partner Profiles</link>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, you configured the agreement to send successfully processed acknowledgements to <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>, so you must set this parameter to <userInput>Success</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, you configured the agreement to send successfully processed acknowledgements to <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Success</codeInline>, so you must set this parameter to <userInput>Success</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Mode
trans-unit.target: Mode

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether the entity is a Queue, one-way relay, or a two-way relay.
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether the entity is a Queue, one-way relay, or a two-way relay.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, because we chose to receive the messages to a one-way relay, you must set this to <userInput>OneWayRelay</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, because we chose to receive the messages to a one-way relay, you must set this to <userInput>OneWayRelay</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, to test the EDI solution, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the MessageReceiver project, and run the following command:
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, to test the EDI solution, open a command prompt, navigate to the solution where you built the MessageReceiver project, and run the following command:

trans-unit.source: This console application shows the message received at the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This console application shows the message received at the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The message is also saved under the \bin\Debug folder of the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: The message is also saved under the \bin\Debug folder of the <embeddedLabel>MessageReceiver</embeddedLabel> project.

trans-unit.source: You can run another instance of the MessageReceiver tool to receive messages that are sent to the failure endpoint, which you configured in the agreement as <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Failure</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: You can run another instance of the MessageReceiver tool to receive messages that are sent to the failure endpoint, which you configured in the agreement as <codeInline>http://<legacyItalic>servicebus namespace</legacyItalic>.servicebus.windows.net/Failure</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Because you enabled tracking as part of the agreement, you can also see the message tracking data as the message is processed by the EDI pipeline.
trans-unit.target: Because you enabled tracking as part of the agreement, you can also see the message tracking data as the message is processed by the EDI pipeline.

trans-unit.source: To view the tracking data, on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Tracking</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To view the tracking data, on the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, click <ui>Tracking</ui>.
